This is subtle. At P/E 30, is Apple overvalued, undervalued, or fair? If overvalued, the buyback transfers wealth from remaining shareholders to those who sell. Apple is basically overpaying. Debt reduction gives better EPS improvement AND maintains financial flexibility. Acquisition could give even higher returns IF Apple can find targets with ROIC above 9%. R&D hurts short-term EPS but could drive long-term growth. My recommendation is don't do a pure $90 billion buyback. Instead, use a balanced approach. Some debt reduction for the EPS benefit and balance sheet strength. Some R&D for long-term growth. Smaller buyback only if stock is genuinely undervalued. You have to consider all stakeholders, signaling effects, and opportunity costs. Thank you for watching.
